title: The Score Uprising
outcome: In the wake of leaked audits and graffiti, neighborhoods traumatized by erratic BCI scoring unite to take matters into their own hands. Residents and technicians collaborate to rewrite their local scoring algorithms, breaking away from city control. Some districts become testbeds for radical egalitarianism; others fall under rule of new 'citizen scores.' The Council is paralyzed as their influence wanes, and Stenograd is transformed by cascading acts of rebellion, creativity, and new local codes.

events.description: A coalition of residents and technicians in a former pilot district hack their neighborhood BCI terminal, replacing city-controlled scoring with a transparent, local set of rules.
Word of the successful rebellion spreads. Other communities adapt their own versions; some choose egalitarian no-score systems, while others form competitive new 'citizen-score' councils.
Council debates response. Directorate wants to send intervention teams, but Innovators advise studying the emerging local models for future reform.
Service workers in several districts begin refusing orders from Council administrators, obeying new neighborhood authorities instead.
Stenograd becomes a patchwork of experimental micro-governments. Citywide services become unpredictable, but public morale surges in liberated areas.
